title: Johann Peter Hebel
summary: Johann Peter Hebel (10 May 1760 – 22 September 1826)[1] was a German short story writer, dialectal poet, lutheran theologian and pedagogue, most famous for a collection of Alemannic lyric poems (Allemannische Gedichte) and one of German tales (Schatzkästlein des rheinischen Hausfreundes – "Treasure Chest of Rhenish Tales").
